title: How to Make Lemonade Using Good Measurements

steps.headline: Be reasonable.
steps.description: Don't make lemonade with a gallon of water and only one lemon. The lemonade will turn out watery and unimpressive. A good rule of thumb when making lemonade is to use a 1:1:5 ratio of lemon juice to sugar to water.

steps.headline: Squeeze 1 1/2 cups (.35 l) juice from lemons using a juicer.
Bring 8 cups (1.9 l) water to boil in a saucepan.
steps.description: Filtered water is best but tap water is perfectly acceptable.

steps.headline: Add 1 3/4 cups (0.4 l) of sugar to the boiling water.
Place the syrup in the refrigerator to cool.
Combine the lemon juice with the syrup, once it has cooled.
steps.description: Stir in a large jug. Serve chilled, with ice, and lemon as garnish (optional).

text: Be reasonable. Don't make lemonade with a gallon of water and only one lemon. The lemonade will turn out watery and unimpressive. A good rule of thumb when making lemonade is to use a 1:1:5 ratio of lemon juice to sugar to water. Squeeze 1 1/2 cups (.35 l) juice from lemons using a juicer.  Bring 8 cups (1.9 l) water to boil in a saucepan. Filtered water is best but tap water is perfectly acceptable. Add 1 3/4 cups (0.4 l) of sugar to the boiling water. Stir until it has dissolved. Place the syrup in the refrigerator to cool.  Combine the lemon juice with the syrup, once it has cooled. Stir in a large jug. Serve chilled, with ice, and lemon as garnish (optional). Finished.
